metadata.Title: CVE-2013-6045 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple heap-based buffer overflows in OpenJPEG 1.3 and earlier might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-6045` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjpeg2 - 1.3+dfsg-4.7ubuntu1
openjpeg-tools - 1.3+dfsg-4.7ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3+dfsg-4.7ubuntu1').
